quest.name: A Helping Hand
journal: Judging by the glint in Runar's eye, there is more for you to learn about Slitherbough.
objectives: Take the water jug to the garden.
Take the water to the garden.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I can see now how they've come to thrive in these woods, even with all the sin eaters.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned. Very good.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: No doubt they were glad of your company. It has been too long since we have had visitors.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Remember: if you have any questions, or there is anything you need, do not hesitate to ask.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, we must arrange food and lodgings for your stay.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: As friends of Master Matoya, we cannot ask for payment, but if you would be willing to lend a hand...?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It would be my pleasure.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'd rather not...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: We are fortunate indeed to play host to such generous souls. The task I have in mind is simple enough.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Come now, it is but a single task. As reward, I will give you an extra helping of my famous stew at dinner!

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: All I ask is that you take a jug and water the crops in the square.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: May I help too?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Of course! One of you can do the filling, and the other the watering.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Speak with Ersabel when you have finished. She will be relieved to hear the crops have been tended to.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: While you take care of that, I will see to your room and a warm meal.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Right, then. I'll fill, you water!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This was the only jug I could find which was small enough to lift, but I'm afraid there's a crack in the bottom.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You'll need to hurry to the garden before all the water leaks out.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Take the jug of water to the square before the contents leak out.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will have forty-five seconds to complete the task. Should you fail, return to Minfilia and try again.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh no, did all the water leak out? Here, let me refill it for you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have watered half of the plot. Fetch another jug of water to take care of the rest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have no water for the crops. Speak with Minfilia to receive a fresh jug.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Was there enough water for the plot?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Only half? I see. Well, let me refill the jug for you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Take another jug of water to the square before the contents leak out.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will have thirty seconds to complete the task. Should you fail, return to Minfilia and try again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The whole plot has now been thoroughly watered.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: All done? Then we just need to speak to...Ersabel, was it?

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: Well met, travelers. I observed you earlier speaking with the others. Have you need of something?

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: You watered the crops? Ah, my apologies for not noticing sooner. I have been...rather distracted of late.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: Watering the crops was always Toddia's duty, but she...she is no longer with us.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: We have since taken to sharing the duty─though never with guests... You are most kind.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Is there anything else we can do to help? We could plant something if you like.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: There is no need. The plot is small, it is true, but it provides us with enough to survive. We ask for no more.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I don't know how you manage...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Have the Blessed not considered leaving? Life would surely be easier almost anywhere else.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: I can understand why you might say that, but the easiest path is not always the right one.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: Tell me, do you know our history? How our faith came to be?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Ah, er...yes, I believe so. The Night's Blessed was initially formed by those who lost their homes in the wake of the Flood.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What began as an occasional gathering of survivors eventually grew into a community, which ultimately decided to strike out on its own in the Rak'tika Greatwood.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: I see you have read your history.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: But there is a history that is told, and one that is lived.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: Like so many in those times, the first of the Night's Blessed lost everything. Their homes, their loved ones─all they held dear.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: To make matters worse, none could say what became of the souls of those lost to the Flood when their bodies were reborn as sin eaters.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: The people were without answers, without hope, their gods having drowned along with everything else. It seemed that nothing was beyond the reach of the Light.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: But soon they realized that where there is Light, there must be Darkness.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: And in that truth, they found new faith─a belief that the souls of the departed could yet find peace beyond these burning skies, in the sunless sea above.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: That is why we pray. For the safe passage of wayward souls unto that blessed black abyss. For the return of the night, that we might someday look upon the kingdom of heaven with our own eyes.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: We remain in these woods for the selfsame reason our founders first chose them─that we may lead lives of simplicity, with the shade of these trees as a constant reminder of our faith.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: With so many seeking paradise in Eulmore, it's refreshing to find people who value a humbler existence.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: You are kind to say so. Many consider our way of life foolish─and so it must seem to those who yet cling to their worldly possessions.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: In times such as these, when everything can be taken away in an instant, it is all too easy to lose sight of why we fight to go on living.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: ...It is not to hold fast to material things, but to hold those who went before us in our hearts─to keep alive the legacy they have left us.

dialogue.name: ERSABEL
dialogue.text: This we must do for them, our children, and generations yet unborn.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: ...To keep their legacy alive.
